children.title: M1: Improved quality of examples & documentation
M1: Python SDK for easy interaction with Bacalhau from Python
M1 mac running (or equivalent) should be <2 min for most jobs
Figure out correct patterns (e.g. t.Run, Suites, etc)
Remove all logging information during test runs and/or devstack
Template for implementing new Suite, new Noop test, new Full Devstack test
Remove use of Docker for things that don't test Docker
CircleCI failing due to missing docker or failing to pull images
Refactor all of these tests to use common functionality; they're all very similar
figure out how to test for CIDs that are not local
alerting on performance dashboard - if perf tests start going 10% slower
Add unit tests for compute node state machine
Have a test that runs before everything that verifies the state of test
Make sure all things are cleanly runnable offline
Logging in tests still not great
uploading files to devstack ipfs nodes
fix test flakiness when running multiple wasm tests
M1: FIL+ integration launches, CPs doing the job can “win” verified deals first
M1: FIL+ Dashboard and UX for moderators in place
Default for Server Setup takes no parameters to join default network
check compute node has all installed components
M1: Communication on work on protocol for eventual native incentive mechanism
Make the Bacalhau network more resilient to losing messages on libp2p, and nodes failing/coming back

Get to API stability for the Job, JobSpec, etc structs so that we can turn on persistence without being unable to upgrade nodes in future, and for the yaml/json versions too - IOW, change whatever we want to change before we commit to the API
Turn on persistence by implementing a sqlite version of the localdb - right now when we restart a bacalhau server it forgets everything! so upgrades e.g. break `bacalhau list` etc
Estuary publisher should be more resilient
M1: What happens if a job can't do anything in the sequence of steps it needs to do - do we error? Yes at the moment, but ideally we'd retry and try it again
rethink the use of pointers, maps and slices for concurrency
concurrency=1 but 3 nodes are getting bid accepted
Improve ipfs add performance for large trees of files & directories
try reverting libp2p change in a branch and see if it makes tests less flaky
Can't fetch stderr of a job with container exit code 1
Agree on draft Invocation Spec for IPVM interoperability with other CoD projects
M1: Create hackathon materials that can be updated for each quarter, and hold one hackathon with them
M1: DevEx feedback loop between community and Eng/PM
M1: Give 2 micro grants to developers
